term.name: holism
term.source: From Greek holos: whole, complete, entire.
term.def: The idea that all things and events in the universe are inseparably connected. Holism is opposed to &dualism; but respects &particularism; and therefore is also generally opposed to &monism; because interconnection does not imply unity. The basic principle of holism is sometimes also applied to more particular topics, such as the view (opposed to &dualism;) that human beings are a seamless combination of mind and body.
